name: Deep One Hybrid (Bearer of the Innsmouth Taint)
appearance: A largely human-looking individual bearing subtle but disturbing aquatic traits: slightly bulging, unblinking eyes; thickened lips; coarse skin; and an unusual body odor reminiscent of the sea. With age, these traits grow more pronounced as the transformation toward a true Deep One progresses.
personality: Withdrawn, secretive, and inwardly conflicted. Younger hybrids may cling to human identity, while older ones who accept their aquatic heritage become calm, fatalistic, and increasingly alien in outlook.
background: Deep One hybrids are the descendants of humans tainted by the Innsmouth bloodline. Though born human, they inevitably undergo a gradual transformation into full Deep Ones later in life. Some remain unaware of their heritage for years, while others are raised within communities that normalize or even revere their destiny.
goals: Survive while hiding their true heritage
Eventually answer the call of the sea
secrets: All hybrids will eventually transform into full Deep Ones if they live long enough
Older hybrids may already commune with Deep Ones or aquatic Mythos entities

clues.clueText: Deep One hybrids age normally but will eventually undergo a complete transformation into Deep Ones.
Older hybrids who accept their heritage may possess forbidden spells.

notes:
Combat & Abilities:

Combat Style:
Deep One hybrids can use standard human weapons and attack once per round.

Attacks:
• Fighting 45% (22/9): Damage is based on the weapon used plus damage bonus, or unarmed strike for 1D3 + damage bonus.

Armor:
None.

Spells:
Older hybrids who have begun to accept their aquatic heritage have a 10% chance to know 1D3 spells.

Skills (Racial Tendencies):
• Stealth 46%
• Swim 60%
• Jump 45%
• Dodge 30% (15/6)
• Listen 50%

Special Ability – Limited Aquatic Endurance:
Before fully transforming into Deep Ones, hybrids cannot breathe underwater. However, from early childhood they can hold their breath underwater for up to twice as long as a normal human.

Sanity Loss:
Seeing a Deep One hybrid causes SAN loss of 0 / 1D4. Particularly horrifying individuals may cause increased loss (1 / 1D6 or higher) at the Keeper’s discretion.

Keeper Notes:
Hybrids work best as slow-burn horror elements. Their tragedy lies in inevitability rather than immediate monstrosity, making them effective long-term NPCs or revelations tied to Innsmouth-related investigations.
